member.name: T:Sceelix.Points.Procedures.PointsCreateProcedure.SurfaceScatterLayerDistanceParameter
member.summary: Sets a variable distance between the points, based on the intensity of a chosen layer. The intensity values of the layer will be mapped to the generated point density. Layer values below a certain threshold will be filtered so as to define areas where no points are generated.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Points.Procedures.PointsCreateProcedure.SurfaceScatterLayerDistanceParameter._parameterLayerIndex
member.summary:
Index of the layer which contains the intensity information. Should be a floating-point based layer, such as a height or blend layer.
By default, the index 0 means the height layer.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Points.Procedures.PointsCreateProcedure.SurfaceScatterLayerDistanceParameter._parameterThreshold
member.summary: The layer value below which no points will be placed (in a 0-1 relative range). This works as a mask, meaning that, for instance, in those areas where the layer value is below this value, no points will be placed.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Points.Procedures.PointsCreateProcedure.SurfaceScatterLayerDistanceParameter._parameterMinDistance
member.summary: The minimum distance between the generated points. This corresponds to the layer areas with highest values, creating therefore areas with higher point density.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Points.Procedures.PointsCreateProcedure.SurfaceScatterLayerDistanceParameter._parameterMaxDistance
member.summary: The maximum distance between the generated points. This corresponds to the layer areas with lowest values, creating therefore areas with lower point density.

member.name: F:Sceelix.Points.Procedures.PointsCreateProcedure.SurfaceScatterLayerDistanceParameter._distanceAttribute
member.summary: The actual distance calculated for the point.
